name: Pink Onion
author: JH M.
description:
When I book a table for two and walk into a restaurant with empty tables, I don't expect to be mandated to sit at the bar.

The greeter was really rude and wouldn't let me sit at my booked table.

The ruder he got, the more I dug my heels in and insisted on the table. I got the table and they're getting this terrible review.

Too many great restaurants in this city for me to waste my time in that gin joint.

And that greeter either needs to be retrained in restaurant etiquette, or needs to be fired. I know what I'd do.
